shortdesc.ph: Registers an audio frame observer object.
Registers an audio frame observer object.

p.codeblock: public abstract int RegisterAudioFrameObserver(IAudioFrameObserver audioFrameObserver, AUDIO_FRAME_POSITION position, OBSERVER_MODE mode = OBSERVER_MODE.INTPTR);

section.p: This method registers an audio frame observer object, i.e., registers callbacks. You need to call this method to register callbacks if you want the SDK to trigger the , , , , and callbacks.
This method registers an audio frame observer, i.e., registers callbacks. You need to call this method to register callbacks when the SDK needs to trigger , , , , and .
This method registers an audio observer object, i.e., registers callbacks. When you need the SDK to trigger , , , , and callbacks, you need to call this method to register the callbacks.
This method registers an audio frame observer object, i.e., registers callbacks. You need to call this method to register the callbacks if you want the SDK to trigger the , , , , and callbacks.

section.title: Timing
section.p: This method must be called before joining a channel.
This method must be called before joining a channel.
This method must be called before joining a channel.
You need to call this method before joining a channel.

plentry.pd: Instance of the interface object. See . It is recommended to call this after receiving to release the audio frame observer object.
Instance of the interface object. See . It is recommended to call this after receiving to release the audio frame observer.
Instance of the interface object. See . It is recommended to call this after receiving to release the audio observer object.
Instance of the interface object. See . Passing NULL means unregistering. It is recommended to call this method after receiving to release the audio frame observer object.

Audio observation position.
AUDIO_FRAME_POSITION_PLAYBACK (0x0001): Observes the playback audio after mixing from all remote users. Corresponds to the callback.
AUDIO_FRAME_POSITION_RECORD (0x0002): Observes the captured audio of the local user. Corresponds to the callback.
AUDIO_FRAME_POSITION_MIXED (0x0004): Observes the audio after mixing from the local and all remote users. Corresponds to the callback.
AUDIO_FRAME_POSITION_BEFORE_MIXING (0x0008): Observes the audio of a single remote user before mixing. Corresponds to the callback.
AUDIO_FRAME_POSITION_EAR_MONITORING (0x0010): Observes the ear monitoring audio of a single local user. Corresponds to the callback.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and suggested solutions.
